Key Arguments: The submission argues that information should be considered neutrally and individuals should be allowed to form their own opinions rather than being directed by the government.
The claim that misinformation and disinformation are threats to safety and wellbeing is considered fallacious by the submitter.
The government is accused of spreading misinformation itself, particularly regarding the safety and effectiveness of COVID-19 vaccinations.
The government is criticized for exempting itself from the restrictions it seeks to impose on the public.
The legislation is viewed as undemocratic and contrary to the promises made by the Albanese Government during elections.
Notable Quotes: Isn’t it incumbent upon people to consider and reflect upon that information rather than be directed to adopt someone else’s view that what they are receiving as information is dis….or mis…?
It is only a Government afraid of people finding out what it is really up to that would seek to attempt to silence people in this way.
TRUTH does not mind being questioned. A LIE does not like being challenged.
